p: Eugenol has also been known for its antimicrobial properties. The antimicrobial activity of eugenol against Propionibacterium acnes, Pityrosporum ovale, E. coli, C. albicans, S. aureus MRSA, and P. aeruginosa showed MIC values of 50 μg/mL, 100 μg/mL, 800 μg/mL, 800 μg/mL, 1600 μg/mL, and 1600 μg/mL, respectively [ 34], and only for the two first microorganisms was this compound more active. The lower activity detected for the oil rich in eugenol ( 2) can be caused by interactions between the oil components leading to antagonist, additive or synergistic effects [ 35].
